Let $f_k(n)$ denote the smallest integer such that any $f_k(n)$ points in general position in $\mathbb{R}^k$ contain $n$ which determine a convex polyhedron. Is it true that\[f_k(n) > (1+c_k)^n\]for some constant $c_k>0$?



The function when $k=2$ is the subject of the Erd\H{o}s-Klein-Szekeres conjecture, see [107]. One can show that\[f_2(n)>f_3(n)>\cdots.\]The answer is no, even for $k=3$: Pohoata and Zakharov \cite{PoZa22} have proved that\[f_3(n)\leq 2^{o(n)}.\]




References


[PoZa22] Pohoata, C. and Zakharov, D., Convex polytopes from fewer points. arXiv:2208.04878 (2022).
